timeline.message:
testing: updated docker-compose.yml

Commit adds utility `up` script to bring up docker images, wait for ksql to be responsive, and then load the cli.  `down` to bring everything down again.

`.env` file added with environment vars for setting docker version.

updated some outdated links too.

timeline.author: vcrfxia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+# Sets environment variables used in docker-compose.yml
+
+# Set to specific version needed, e.g. 5.5.0
+#CP_VERSION=latest

timeline.bodyText:

@@ -0,0 +1,23 @@

+
+# exit when any command fails

timeline.author: vcrfxia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,7 @@
+#!/bin/bash
+
+# exit when any command fails
+set -e
+
+echo -e "## Bringing down contains:\n"

timeline.bodyText: Hang on, why are we undoing this change? Builds with the latest Dockerfile should fail with this change. Do they not for you?
timeline.author: vcrfxia
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -13,7 +13,7 @@ To build a new image with local changes:
 
 1. Build docker images from local changes.
     ```
-    > mvn -Pdocker package -DskipTests -Dspotbugs.skip -Dcheckstyle.skip  -Ddockerfile.skip=false -Dskip.docker.build=false -Ddocker.upstream-tag=latest-ubi8 -Ddocker.tag=local.build  -Ddocker.upstream-registry=''
+    > mvn -Pdocker package -DskipTests -Dspotbugs.skip -Dcheckstyle.skip  -Ddockerfile.skip=false -Dskip.docker.build=false -Ddocker.upstream-tag=latest -Ddocker.tag=local.build  -Ddocker.upstream-registry=''
